intended_use.primary_use_cases: Predict whether an individual's income exceeds $50,000 per year based on demographic and employment-related attributes.
intended_use.out_of_scope_use: The model should not be used for discriminatory decisions based on protected attributes (e.g., race, sex) or for high-stakes decisions without human review.

model_architecture.description: Statistical and binary classification model that uses a logistic function to model a binary dependent variable.
model_architecture.input_format: Numerical and categorical features after preprocessing (including one-hot encoding).
model_architecture.output_format: Predicted class label and associated probabilities.

preprocessing: Imputation of missing values with most frequent
training_data.data_balance: Income >50K is underrepresented; model trained with stratified sampling.

evaluation_metrics.test_dataset: Split from original Adult Dataset with Stratified K-Fold Cross-Validation

ethical_considerations.bias_and_fairness: Model may reflect biases present in the 1994 census data and should be monitored for dataset drift.
risks: Discriminatory use in hiring or lending
Over-reliance on predictions for individual decisions
Poor generalization to modern or international contexts
mitigations: Continually improve data and modeling pipeline
Use model outputs as decision support, not decision makers

performance: Random Forest may miss complex non-linear interactions
Performance depends on data quality and relevance
generalization: Limited to 1994 U.S. census data context
Not validated for other countries or modern income data
assumptions: Preprocessed data reflects actual population characteristics
